mapper.sql: a.id AS "id", a.tech_id AS "techId", a.start_time AS "startTime", a.end_time AS "endTime", a.remark AS "remark", a.create_by AS "createBy.id", a.create_date AS "createDate", a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", a.update_date AS "updateDate", a.del_flag AS "delFlag"
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO tech_holiday( id, tech_id, start_time, end_time, create_by, create_date, update_by, update_date, remark, del_flag ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{techId}, #{startTime}, #{endTime}, #{createBy.id}, #{createDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{remark}, #{delFlag} )
mapper.update: UPDATE tech_holiday SET tech_id = #{techId}, start_time = #{startTime}, end_time = #{endTime}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, remark = #{remark} WHERE id = #{id}
mapper.select: select count(*) from order_info a left join order_dispatch b on a.id = b.order_id where a.del_flag = #{DEL_FLAG_NORMAL} and b.del_flag = #{DEL_FLAG_NORMAL} AND b.status='yes' and b.tech_id = #{techId} and ((a.service_time <= #{startTime} AND a.finish_time > #{startTime}) OR (a.service_time >= #{startTime} AND a.service_time < #{endTime})) and (a.order_status = 'dispatched' or a.order_status = 'started')
SELECT a.id AS "id", a.week AS "holiday", a.start_time AS "startTime", a.end_time AS "endTime" FROM tech_work_time a WHERE a.tech_id = #{techId} AND a.del_flag = '0' order by a.week
